document_data.name: The Fitting End of the Human King Halthor
document_data.mainbody:
'''''The Fitting End of the Human King Halthor''''' was an old [[elven]] stage play.
{{quote|''The royal smile broadened. "Die rich? And so he shall-put that into his hands and then slide your sword through him. Several times is the current fashion, I believe."''|Final line of '''The Fitting End of the Human King Halthor''' as played in [[Erladden Towers]] in {{yearlinkName|240}}}}
document_data.History: In the {{yearlinkName|240}}, ''The Fitting End of the Human King Halthor'' was played in the [[Ereladden Towers]] of [[Myth Drannor|Cormanthor]].
